headers(field, val){*}

isomorphic/http.js, line 52

Adds a header to the http response.

This only has an effect on the server.

Name Type Description
field
val

redirect(status, url)

isomorphic/http.js, line 119

Redirect to the given url with optional response status defaulting to 302.

This only has an effect on the server.

The resulting url is determined by res.location(), so it will play nicely with mounted apps, relative paths, "back" etc.

Examples:

http.redirect('/foo/bar');
http.redirect('http://example.com');
http.redirect(301, 'http://example.com');
http.redirect('../login'); // /blog/post/1 -> /blog/login
Name Type Description
status number optional
url string

status(code)

isomorphic/http.js, line 30

Set the http status code.

This only has an effect on the server.

Name Type Description
code number

type(type)

isomorphic/http.js, line 91

Set Content-Type response header with type through mime.lookup() when it does not contain "/", or set the Content-Type to type otherwise.

This only has an effect on the server.

Examples:

http.type('.html');
http.type('html');
http.type('json');
http.type('application/json');
http.type('png');
Name Type Description
type string
Documentation updated on May 21, 2015
